result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Wilmer Salinas

records.addlTxt: Signed by TCH on 10/26/22.  c: SCSO. bph

DE called to inquire what time his court was scheduled for today, and also to say he had tested positive for Covid. Clerk advised the hearing was already held, and a warrant was issued based on his non appearance. Clerk advised DE could turn himself in or write a letter requesting the warrant be quashed and provided COC fax info. olg

9:55 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges. Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph Willmer Salinas not in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Joseph Willmer Salinas. Set for PH. Court notes hearing was originally scheduled for 9:30 AM and no parties are in Zoom. Court issues warrant - body only. Adjourned 9:57 AM. srb

10:37 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for EFV, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: S. Bridges. Defendant Joseph Willmer Salinas not in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Joseph Willmer Salinas.  Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Set for status. Atty. Satorius says he spoke with DE who would try to appear by Zoom. Court authorizes warrant. STAYED. Adjourned 10:42 AM.  Court notes that DE called in via Zoom after the hearing concluded. Clerk advised DE to contact his attorney as the hearing already concluded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. kma   to rg

1:33 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph Willmer Salinas in court. Court confirms address and DE updates Phone number. Court quashed warrant. Court sets STC. ADA Damrau makes statements re: testing. DE states in out patient treatment and is on the color wheel in Washburn Co, MN. Court orders DE to test today at JSC. Court continues suspension of testing. Court to address at next hearing. Adjourned 01:36 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:30 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel. Defendant Joseph Willmer Salinas not in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Joseph Willmer Salinas.  Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin. Set for PH.  Court notes message from DE; acknowledges traffic issues. Court suggests having DE stay and come back at 1:00 pm since he is also on intake. Court issues warrant, stays until 4:30 pm today.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits on PH. When DE appears, will set a STC.
Return on warrant scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:05 pm.
Return on warrant on August 25, 2022 at 01:05 pm.

11:20 AM- DE called stating he has court at 11:30 and will be about 45 minutes late. Clerk advised she would notify the clerk, but also gave him the phone # for PD to try to get a message to his atty as well.  gll
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

re: DE admitted into Haven Chemical Health Systems LLC Residential High Intensity Residential Treatment Facility on Monday 06/27/22. Program is approx. 45-60 days. with signed authorization form. Filed by Jennifer F.J- Haven Chemical Health Systems. arc       Per TCH on 6/30 good cause found to extend time for prelim. JA will reschedule w/ Attys. arc
Pretrial Bond Report. Filed by JSC. SEALED. km       to rg
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Prelim set for 5-19-2022 reset due to Def. being in Washington Co. MN Jail. JA reset w/ DA and Atty. Satorius to 7-5-2022. RJG
DE's brother called and stated DE is in custody in MN and was wondering if court date could be rescheduled. Clerk provided PD number to contact atty. arc
By self - 22R 005818. jaf

per EFV. hml

Faxed to Dispatch, Quash Sheriff & Jail
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

-$375.00 Bond on File.

- Defendant must test clean before release.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to drug testing every monday by 09:00AM every week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, FleetFarm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:21 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Abrianna Dolfi w/ Intern Kaitlyn Dippolito, DF: Joseph Willmer Salinas appeared in custody. Court reviews case. Intern Dippolito notes DE waived extradition to appear. Bond Arguements. Wavies Speedy prelim Court Amends bond. Quash Warrant. Court to consider modification if DE has a bed awaiting for treatment. Court sets STC. Adjourned  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Extraditable Adjoining states. Signed by RMW on 03/31/22. arc  c: SCSO with complaint. e:DA and Atty Satorius

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Erica Ellenwood, NONA by def. Case called at 1:28 p.m. Court reviews file. Was scheduled for a return on warrant. DE had missed court appearance in Branch 2 and warrant was stayed until today. DE does not appear. Court notes receiving notice from JSC DE in not in compliance with testing. ADA Ellenwood requesting a warrant. Court will lift stay and issue warrant, extraditable adjoining states.
Re: Defendant Testing at JSC. Filed by S.H. SEALED. km             to kap
Filed by ADA Brekken. km
Supplemental Report. Field by JSC. arc  Sealed
Return on warrant on March 31, 2022 at 01:05 pm.

02:35 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Joseph Willmer Salinas did not appear. Set for PH. Court reviews case. Atty Satorius doesnt know DE's whereabouts. ADA Brekken doesnt believe DE is obsconding due to multiple phone calls from DE. Court issues Warrant- Stayed unitl 03/31/22. Court notes if verification is provided DE is in treatment testing to amend bond. Adjourned 02:38 PM  Return on warrant scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:05 pm.

01:55 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Michelle P Brekken, DF ATTY: Travis Satorius, DF: Joseph Willmer Salinas appeared. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Defendant qualifies for PD. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets PH.
